column2: Alamo Fortress

An iconic symbol of Texas, the Alamo was the sight of the mythical first battle that formed Old Texas. Since the first Texan Magnate, the site has seen new extensive fortifications built up around the mission and the garrison fights on with indomitable spirit of Texas to never surrender.

A singular symbol of Texas, the Alamo was the sight of an ancient battle. Since the first Texan Magnate the site has seen new fortifications built up around the mission both to protect it and to provide a fortress to command from that will never surrender.
San Antonio Riverwalk

despite the centuries, the Riverwalk is still a beautiful oasis like place in the Texas heat. The riverside markets the waterworks that protect them from flooding are lovingly preserved by the townsfolk of San Antonio through dozens of traditions and festivals that maintain and celebrate it.
Alamo Mission

The heart of the Alamo Fortress, the Alamo Mission is a place of supreme importance to the history of Texas. Countless Lords and the Bannercaptains before them have sought its symbolism and in doing so gave it new legitimacy as the site of dozens of new important events.
Alamo Armory
Alamo armory description
Houston Harbor

Houston Harbor may never match its former glory, but the foundations remain in the sheltered bay of houston. The harbor brought in more goods than any other port in the ancient American Empire. Now the concrete piers are maintained by strict tradition by lineages of port masters.

Houston Harbor may never match its former glory, but the foundations remain in the sheltered bay of houston. Its concrete piers once brought in more goods than any other port in the ancient American Empire. Now the concrete piers are maintained by strict tradition.
The Aggieland War

The reports from the north have been confirmed. That bastard priest-steward in Brazos has openly declared that he no longer recognizes you as the leader of the Aggies and is raising troops to depose you. Your marshal has already begun to summon the rangers to defend your right to lead our realm. Messengers have also arrived from the west. Troops from the land of the longhorns have crossed into milashison, and they have proclaimed some shallow lie about claims stemming from the time of the High Queen in that region. [Root.GetSpymasterName] had warned you that the whorseson in Austin might be whispering into the ear of the Bishop, but now it seem that whatever promises [d_longhorns.Holder.GetTitledName] made to the Bishop will die with the traitor.
We don't have the men to take on the traitor and the schemer both. Punishing [d_aggies.Holder.GetTitledFirstName]'s treachery will have to wait.

Your plan has finally come together milord. The priest-steward of Brazos has raised troops in open revolt. He suspects nothing and our troops have already crossed the border unopposed. We expect that we can take Milashison well before the Aggies can do anything about it. We expect that many Starfolk won't believe our claims but the pope can't tell our High Queen from a Queen Bee and the Heathen founder worshippers won't be around much longer anyway.
Today Milashison, and tomorrow we will secure our control over the Colorado!

Reports have come from the Brazos River region that the priest-steward of Brazos has declared independence from the chief of the Aggies. [d_aggies.Holder.GetTitledName] has raised troops and is marching to secure his rightful throne of College Station, but in the west Longhorn riders have crossed into Milashison. They are claiming that Aggie control there is in violation of the High Queen entrusting that land to them.
This can be our chance to expand in the area.
I wonder what other "promises" the Longhorns have conjured.
The Grand Kingdom of Texas
The Grand Kingdom of Texas is restored
By the rights of the First High Queen I am crowned.
We are bound by our oaths to serve the High  [root.GetKingQueen].
Oath or no [root.GetTitledFirstName] is not our [root.GetKingQueen].
My suzerain grows more powerful.
May Founders guide [root.GetTitledFirstName].
May God bless [root.GetTitledFirstName].
May Atomos empower [root.GetTitledFirstName].
It seems Texas is no longer the playground of other Empires.
Will [root.GetTitledFirstName] be as tolerant as the High Queen was?
A Life Guard?

History has shown that the future of the Grand Kingdom of Texas lives and dies with the life and actions of its founding High [Root.GetKingQueen]. Commanders stand ready to take up a new standard and to fight and die so that you and by extension the Grand Kingdom of Texas may live.\nWe may simply establish a new position, but two banners are tied to oaths to defend Texas, and It is expected for the High King to not hold onto the banner themself so setting aside on in our control to become our guard's banner might be fitting.

History has shown that the future of the Grand Kingdom of Texas lives and dies with the life and actions of its founding High [Root.GetKingQueen]. Commanders stand ready to take up a new standard and to fight and die so that you and by extension the Grand Kingdom of Texas may live.\nWe may simply establish a new position, but two banners are tied to oaths to defend Texas, and as Americanists two of our banners fought and defended America itself in its time. They could be asked to take on their ancient duty and defend the future of America in Texas.

History has shown that the future of the Grand Kingdom of Texas lives and dies with the life and actions of its founding High [Root.GetKingQueen]. Commanders stand ready to take up a new standard and to fight and die so that you and by extension the Grand Kingdom of Texas may live.\nWe may simply establish a new position, but two banners are tied to oaths to defend Texas, and the range is filled with rangers that have honed their skills protecting pilgrim caravans from the Americanist heathens and misguided Sagrado. These outriders could be organized to serve Texas and God now that those threats are over or will soon be over.

History has shown that the future of the Grand Kingdom of Texas lives and dies with the life and actions of its founding High [Root.GetKingQueen]. Commanders stand ready to take up a new standard and to fight and die so that you and by extension the Grand Kingdom of Texas may live.\nWe may simply establish a new position, but two banners are tied to oaths to defend Texas. Additionally warriors from the West arrive everyday eager to earn their place in this new empire. Under our guidance they could be organized into a novel force serving Atomos and Texas both.
This new guard should serve Texas only.
I I hold Red Raider and can alter its oath. Red Raider and can alter its oath.
I lead the First Cav and can alter its oath.
I hold Airmen and can alter its oath.
Texas is god's land.
A Life Guard?

With the excitement gripping every corner of Texas, It's not long until the new Guard is assembled before you. Just looking at them you can see they are the proudest, toughest, and most tenacious rangers from across the Texas plains collected for the first time in centuries. Each one is ready and willing to bring the enemies of texas to their knees.

The Spectral Banner passes from your hands into the hands of its new commander. Just looking at the men assembled behind him, you can see they are the proudest, toughest, and most fearome rangers from across the Texas plains collected for the first time in centuries. Each one is ready and willing to bring the enemies of texas to their knees beneath their grim standard..

The Sriped Banner passes from your hands into the hands of its new commander. Behind him the hundred most elite rangers dressed as the First Cav's riders did nearly seven centuries ago fall to their knees and recite their oaths, to you, to America, and to Texas. In their gleaming eyes you can see their dedication to the American Dream.

The Astral Banner passes from your hands into the hands of its new commander. He and the warriors assembled behind him kneel as they give their new oath. Each promises that no matter how dark the path ahead may become they will follow the Astral Banner and give everything to defend You and Texas.

Under the direction of [Root.GetTitledFirstName] a new knightly order has been assembled in the Heart of Texas from the many brave rangers that have for generations sheperded faithful pilgrims in Texas. These outriders are already hard warriors dedicated to god, but they are unused to being commanded. Confident in them and in God you know they will not fail you.

New converts to Atomos and warriors from out West willing to make Texas their new homeland flock now to the assembly square in Austin ready to give their lives for Atomos and Texas. The new arrivals pledge everything to defend their new home, and the new converts promise even more.
The best of the best at my command.
The Spectral Banner is now a grim promise to any who would threaten Texas.
With them at my command the American Dream will be restored.
With them at my command all enemies under the skies of America will come to fear Texas
May god guide my blade!
Form the Kingdom of [k_yellowrose.Title.GetName]

The south of Texas while not often united by a kingdom has an identity both distinct from and bridging the greater kingdoms of [k_old_star.Title.GetName] and [k_rio_grande.Title.GetName]. Centered on the Grand Town of San Antonio, or as the Texans know it San Antone, its access to both the rio grande and the port of corpus makes it a wealthy if not as developed region.
Form the Kingdom of [k_silvercrown.Title.GetName]

Lying at the heart of [k_old_star.Title.GetName], the people of [k_silvercrown.Title.GetName] consider themselves as the heart of Texas itself. The Grand Town of Austin has served as a seat of power in texas since before the ____ and after under the reign of the High Queen. For any that would reign over Texas and its people their journey must end or begin at this ancient seat of power.
Form the Kingdom of [k_star_coast.Title.GetName]

Lying along the South East of [k_old_star.Title.GetName], the term [k_star_coast.Title.GetName] arose to distinguish it from the greater Gulf Coast region. Distinct both in diet and in ecology the coatal region of Texas derives great prosperity from the sea, and that prosperity is jealously fought over by the two Grand Towns of Houston and Galveston.
Form the Kingdom of [k_texarkana.Title.GetName]

The kingdom of Texarkana is an ancient titan of east texas that shares a history of frustration and tragedy that matches that of the high kingdom itself. The first kingdom reigned for nearly a century and met its end as the last conquest of the first high queen, and their last king was defeated at the hands of the king of yellowrose Aaron the Kind. Though often the foes of would be high kings,  between those two rulers they have just as often been candidates in their own right and their legacy is respected.
Form the Kingdom of [k_highlands.Title.GetName]

The Highlands region of Texas stradles the massive llano estacado, the edge of the staked plains demarcating its eastern edge and its western extent contested with Newexican clans. The Highlands once the birthplace of the High Queen is now dominated by catholic rulers with americanism and its last unionist clan executed by the texan duke if Amarillo as they attempted to flee south east ater the defeat of the atomocist new mexican warlords that they had joined.
Form the Kingdom of [k_westex.Title.GetName]

Laying in the far west of Texas, the region of Westex often overlaps with the neighboring regions of Highlands and Yellowrose. Its only uncontroversial area is also it's heart, El Paso, and it often extends to include Midland. At its greatest  extent under the Western Protectorate Westex came to include Lubbock and all of Middle Rio Grande.
Hold the Election For High King

Being a King of the Starfolk, assembling the first six banners, and securing the grand assemblyground of Dallas. Any Texan who could do these three things would have an entirely undeniable right to restore the Assembly of Rangers and be elected High King.
Restore the Banner of Yutep
The Dragon Banner currently has no bearer and can be restored.
Restore the Red Raider's Banner
The Spectral Banner currently has no bearer and can be restored.
Restore the Longhorn Banner
The Horned Banner currently has no bearer and can be restored.
Restore the Banner of the First Cav
The Striped Banner currently has no bearer and can be restored.
Restore the Banner of the Airmen
The Astral Banner currently has no bearer and can be restored.
Restore the Banner of Aggieland
The Banner of Aggieland currently has no bearer and can be restored.
Airmen Restored

The banner of the Airmen traces its martial might to before the event. Under the Magnate it was an Unionist warrior Banner tasked with defending the Eastern Rio Grande from reprisals and raids from Mexico. Ever vigilant, their duty bound them from openly embracing the future High Queen. They were the last Banner to swear an oath to her, but when they did so before the assembled Banners of the Grand Fair they swayed the last undecided votes.\n\nNow [Root.GetTitledFirstName] has sworn again that oath. [Root.GetSubjectPronounCap] has raised the Winged Star Banner once more over the Town of San Antonio, and the Grand Kingdom of Texas is one step closer to restored
I pledge to uphold this oath with my every breath.
The High Queen's legacy continues.
Who cares about some dead High Queen?
Yutep Restored

The Banner of Yutep was the third Banner sworn to support the first High Queen. As part of the oath of allegiance the leader of the Yutep gave to her crown he promised to defend the knowledge gathered in the Dragon's Hall. Even after the New Mexican invasion of West Texas, and in part because of it some of that knowledge still remains, and consequently the Oath can be sworn again and the banner re-raised.\n\nNow [Root.GetTitledFirstName] has sworn again that oath. [Root.GetSubjectPronounCap] has raised the Dragon Banner once more over the Town of El Paso, and the Grand Kingdom of Texas is one step closer to restored.
I swear to defend the future of Texas.
The High Queen's legacy continues.
Who cares about some dead High Queen?
Red Raider Restored

The Red Raider was the first to fight beside the future High Queen, and first of the unionist banner leaders to adopt her Americanist beliefs. Upon their defeat of the Highland Tyrant Marrion, he gave the first of the Banner Oaths that he would drive any enemy of the planned Grand Kingdom of Texas off of the Estacado. Until the Estacado is flattened the Oath remains to be taken up again and the banner re-raised.\n\nNow [Root.GetTitledFirstName] has sworn again that oath. [Root.GetSubjectPronounCap] has raised the Spectral Banner once more over the Town of Lubbock, and the Grand Kingdom of Texas is one step closer to restored.
I pledge to defend Texas till the Highlands collapse beneath me.
The High Queen's legacy continues.
Who cares about some dead High Queen?
Longhorn Restored

The Longhorns were the fourth banner to rally to the High Queen's cause, and the second non unionist one. Unlike other banners the Longhorns were a banner that held influence over texans across the entire Magnateship of Texas. Their political sway and power were such that with them supporting the High Queen she could defy the Magnate and hold a Bannerassembly, and that support they swore to use for the good of Texas. \n\nNow [Root.GetTitledFirstName] has sworn again that oath. [Root.GetSubjectPronounCap] has raised the Horned Banner once more over the Town of Austin, and the Grand Kingdom of Texas is one step closer to restored.
I pledge to defend Texas from treachery and evil.
The High Queen's legacy continues.
Who cares about some dead High Queen?
Aggies Restored

The Aggies were One of the most faithful pre-High Queen banners. They firmly rejected the unionist philosophy and the Americanist faith its adherents adopted under the High Queen. This did not stop them from joining the High Queen before the congress of Banners. The Magnate had grown too corrupt for resolute and devout Aggies and despite their faith differences they were swayed by the conviction and bravy of the High Queen and believed her promise of restored rights.\n\nNow [Root.GetTitledFirstName] has sworn again that oath. [Root.GetSubjectPronounCap] has raised the Aggieland Banner once more over the Town of Collegestation, and the Grand Kingdom of Texas is one step closer to restored.
I swear to defend the soul of Texas.
The High Queen's legacy continues.
Who cares about some dead High Queen?
First Cav Restored

The banner of the First Cav traces its martial might to before the event, and was one of the most outspoken Unionist Banners. Already skirting open revolt in response to the brutal repression of their unionist beliefs, the news of the arrival of the future High Queen and this new Americanist belief she had brought with her inspired the First Cav Bannercaptain to assemble his banner and ride out to support her. His oath pledged every blade under his Banner to defend the High Queen.\n\nNow [Root.GetTitledFirstName] has sworn again that oath. [Root.GetSubjectPronounCap] has raised the Striped Banner once more over Hood Fortress, and the Grand Kingdom of Texas is one step closer to restored.
I pledge my command and soul to defend Texas and its rights.
The High Queen's legacy continues.
Who cares about some dead High Queen?
Yellowrose Established

The south of Texas while not often united by a kingdom has an identity both distinct from and bridging the greater kingdoms of [k_old_star.Title.GetName] and [k_rio_grande.Title.GetName]. Centered on the Grand Town of San Antonio, or as the Texans know it San Antone, its access to both the rio grande and the port of corpus makes it a wealthy if not as developed region.\n\nUndisputably [Root.GetTitledFirstName] has united the core of that region, and now they have made it official crowning themselves [Root.GetKingQueen]. Starfolk across Texas are taking note wondering if this ruler might become a viable candidate for High [Root.GetKingQueen].
One step closer to a greater crown.
A new day in Texas.
Who cares about some dumb made up Kingdom?

[d_airmen.Holder.GetSubjectPronounCap] has raised the Winged Star Banner once more over the Town of San Antonio, and [ROOT.GetTitledFirstName] is now one step closer to being elected High [Root.GetKingQueen].
I  am now one step closer to being elected High King
I pledge to uphold this oath with my every breath.
The High Queen's legacy continues.

[d_first_cav.Holder.GetSubjectPronounCap] has raised the Striped Banner once more over Fort Hood, and [ROOT.GetTitledFirstName] is now one step closer to being elected High [Root.GetKingQueen].
I pledge my command and soul to defend Texas and its rights.
The High Queen's legacy continues.
Who cares about some dead High Queen?
Form the Empire of [e_texarkana.Title.GetName]

The Catholic church has long sought a powerful realm to anchor their southern extent to counter the power of the HCC, uniting the southern mississippi and at least Eastern Texas ought to be sufficient.

column1: #The Catholic church has long sought a powerful realm to anchor their southern extent to counter the power of the HCC, uniting the southern mississippi and red river should secure the papacy on both land and river against any southern threat.

column2: Texarkana Established

Ever a dangerous world for the faithful, the Popes and Cardinals have sought for decades that a brave ruler step forward and unite the Southern Mississippi River in the name of Catholicism.  [Root.GetTitledFirstName] has succeeded in this now stands as one of the foremost Champions of God and the Pope. Crowned in St. Louis in the Heart of the Holy See as Emperor of Texas, Arkansas, and Louisiana [Root.GetTitledFirstName] seeks now to stand as a bastion of [Root.GetHisHer] faith against any heathen or Evangelical that would threaten the Catholic church.
This is a crown well earned.
Blessed be [Root.GetTitledFirstName]
The Pope's grip on the plains tightens.
If they wish to test the resolve of a true servant of God, then so be it.
Hold one of the titular Starfolk Kingdoms.
You, a vassal, or a tributary hold the Banner of the Airmen.
You, a vassal, or a tributary hold the Banner of the Aggies.
You, a vassal, or a tributary hold the Banner of the Longhorns.
You, a vassal, or a tributary hold the Banner of the First Cav.
You, a vassal, or a tributary hold the Banner of the Yutep.
You, a vassal, or a tributary hold the Banner of the Red Raider.
Rough Saber
BRough Saber
a simple straightforward blade, made thickly and without elegance.
Keen Saber
Keen Saber
The simple brass hilt gleams in the sun, a universal symbol of west anglo culture feared from sea to shining sea.
Throat Cutter
Throat Cutter
This vicious blade is strangely balanced. it seems to find the throat of your enemies, no matter how you swing it.
Tendon Cutter
Tendon Cutter
This heavy blade has and keeps a razor edge, with one slice it can sever the tendons of the greatest stallion.
Liberator
Liberator
This light blade loves to dance in the hand of a skilled wielder. The curved sword provides an edge to any duelist.
Decapitator
Decapitator
This vicious blade seems to have a hunger all its own, it's edge is often enriched with your enemy's blood as their heads roll on the floor.
Horse Sever
Horse Sever
This heavy blade seems built to be wielded by a giant. Its massive blade in the right hands could sever a horse in two..
Star Blade
Star Blade
This stunning blade seems to glint in some perpetual unseen sunlight. Its shining blade fills the lowest heart with hope and the greatest enemy with fear.
Bannerlord
Bannerlady
Banner Ranger
Banner Holder
Banner Master
Banner Mistress
Bannercaptain
High King
High Queen
Your Highness
Grand Kingdom of
Magnate
This Noble aligns themselves with the Magnates politically, favoring a realm where landed nobles may better rule their demesne without restrictions.
Populist
This Noble aligns themselves with the Populists politically, favoring empowering their monarch and the Range Congress.
Theocrat
This Noble aligns themselves with the Theocrats politically, favoring promoting their faith at the cost of other faiths.
Royalist
This Noble aligns themselves with their liege politically, whether for dynastic or personal reasons they will follow their liege politically and vote as they wish.
Opposition
This Noble openly opposes their liege, whether for dynastic or personal reasons they will oppose their liege politically and vote against their wishes.
